mdx.excerpt: This is the books and research I've looked at - it needs a bit of cleaning, not all the papers here are actually useful! I have notes that used to be here - I'mâ€¦

headings.value: A note on research limitations
Books
Your Code as a Crime Scene <CitationAnchor>(Tornhill 2015)</CitationAnchor>
Making Software: What Really Works, and Why We Believe It <CitationAnchor>(Oram and Wilson 2010)</CitationAnchor>
Papers on Metrics
Predicting Fault Incidence Using Software Change History <CitationAnchor>(Graves et al. 2000)</CitationAnchor>
Does Code Decay? Assessing the Evidence from Change Management Data <CitationAnchor>(Eick et al. 2001)</CitationAnchor>
Where the Bugs Are <CitationAnchor>(Ostrand, Weyuker, and Bell 2004)</CitationAnchor>
Predicting Source Code Changes by Mining Change History <CitationAnchor>(Ying et al. 2004)</CitationAnchor>
Use of Relative Code Churn Measures to Predict System Defect Density <CitationAnchor>(Nagappan and Ball 2005)</CitationAnchor>
Looking for Bugs in All the Right Places <CitationAnchor>(Bell, Ostrand, and Weyuker 2006)</CitationAnchor>
Using Software Dependencies and Churn Metrics to Predict Field Failures: An Empirical Case Study <CitationAnchor>(Nagappan and Ball 2007)</CitationAnchor>
Automating Algorithms for the Identification of Fault-Prone Files <CitationAnchor>(Ostrand, Weyuker, and Bell 2007)</CitationAnchor>
Using Developer Information as a Factor for Fault Prediction <CitationAnchor>(Weyuker, Ostrand, and Bell 2007)</CitationAnchor>
A Metric for Software Readability <CitationAnchor>(Buse and Weimer 2008)</CitationAnchor>
Reading Beside the Lines: Indentation as a Proxy for Complexity Metric <CitationAnchor>(Hindle, Godfrey, and Holt 2008)</CitationAnchor>
The Influence of Organizational Structure on Software Quality: An Empirical Case Study <CitationAnchor>(Nagappan, Murphy, and Basili 2008)</CitationAnchor>
Do Too Many Cooks Spoil the Broth? Using the Number of Developers to Enhance Defect Prediction Models <CitationAnchor>(Weyuker, Ostrand, and Bell 2008)</CitationAnchor>
On the Relationship Between Change Coupling and Software Defects <CitationAnchor>(Dâ€™Ambros, Lanza, and Robbes 2009)</CitationAnchor>
Predicting Faults Using the Complexity of Code Changes <CitationAnchor>(Hassan 2009)</CitationAnchor>
Cross-Project Defect Prediction: A Large Scale Experiment on Data vs. Domain vs. Process <CitationAnchor>(Zimmermann et al. 2009)</CitationAnchor>
Comparing the Effectiveness of Several Modeling Methods for Fault Prediction <CitationAnchor>(Weyuker, Ostrand, and Bell 2010)</CitationAnchor>
Does Measuring Code Change Improve Fault Prediction? <CitationAnchor>(Bell, Ostrand, and Weyuker 2011)</CitationAnchor>
Donâ€™t Touch My Code!: Examining the Effects of Ownership on Software Quality <CitationAnchor>(Bird et al. 2011)</CitationAnchor>
Non-Essential Changes in Version Histories <CitationAnchor>(Kawrykow and Robillard 2011)</CitationAnchor>
Evaluating Complexity, Code Churn, and Developer Activity Metrics as Indicators of Software Vulnerabilities <CitationAnchor>(Shin et al. 2011)</CitationAnchor>
An Empirical Study on the Impact of Duplicate Code <CitationAnchor>(Hotta et al. 2012)</CitationAnchor>
Code Smells Quantification: A Case Study On Large Open Source Research Codebase <CitationAnchor>(Chauhan 2019)</CitationAnchor>
Attitudes, Beliefs, and Development Data Concerning Agile Software Development Practices <CitationAnchor>(Matthies et al. 2019)</CitationAnchor>
Source Code Properties of Defective Infrastructure as Code Scripts <CitationAnchor>(Rahman and Williams 2019)</CitationAnchor>
Papers on Voronoi treemaps
Computing Voronoi Treemaps: Faster, Simpler, and Resolution-Independent <CitationAnchor>(Nocaj and Brandes 2012)</CitationAnchor>
Still to find and read
